metadata.displayname: Disable 3rd Party Components by John Billekens
metadata.description: Disables 3rd party components (scheduled tasks and services) added by Adobe and Google by John Billekens
metadata.author: John Billekens

entry.name: Adobe Acrobat Update Service (AdobeARMservice)
entry.description: Adobe Acrobat Updater keeps your Adobe software up to date.

entry.name: Adobe Acrobat Update Task
entry.description: This task keeps your Adobe Reader and Acrobat applications up to date with the latest enhancements and security fixes

entry.name: Adobe Flash Player NPAPI Notifier Task
entry.description: This task keeps your Adobe Flash NPAPI Player installation up to date with the latest enhancements and security fixes. If this task is disabled or removed, Adobe Flash Player will be unable to automatically secure your machine with the latest security fixes.

entry.name: Adobe Flash Player PPAPI Notifier Task
entry.description: This task keeps your Adobe Flash PPAPI Player installation up to date with the latest enhancements and security fixes. If this task is disabled or removed, Adobe Flash Player will be unable to automatically secure your machine with the latest security fixes.

entry.name: Adobe Flash Player Updater Service (AdobeFlashPlayerUpdateSvc)
entry.description: This service keeps your Adobe Flash Player installation up to date with the latest enhancements

entry.name: Adobe Flash Player Updater Task
entry.description: This task keeps your Adobe Flash Player installation up to date with the latest enhancements and security fixes. If this task is disabled or removed, Adobe Flash Player will be unable to automatically secure your machine with the latest security fixes.

entry.name: Adobe Genuine Monitor Service (AGMService)
entry.description: Adobe Genuine Monitor Service

entry.name: Adobe Genuine Software Integrity Service (AGSService)
entry.description: Adobe Genuine Software Integrity Service

entry.name: AdobeCCAppRegistration-AdobeNotificationClient*
entry.description: Register package for current user

entry.name: AdobeGCInvoker-1.0
entry.description: Part of Adobe Invoker Utility

entry.name: Creative Cloud desktop app Update Service (AdobeUpdateService)
entry.description: Creative Cloud desktop app Update Service

group.description: Specific configuration for Adobe Reader DC

entry.name: Accept browser-based EULA (default user)
entry.description: Reader uses the key EULA. If the EULA is not accepted, the application stops running after a set period of time. Possible values include: 0: Show the EULA because it has not been accepted. 1: Don't show the EULA.

entry.name: Accept EULA (default user)
entry.description: If the EULA is not accepted, the application stops running after a set period of time. Possible values include: 0: Show the EULA because it has not been accepted. 1: Don't show the EULA because it has not been accepted.

entry.name: Disable Adobe Send and Track plugin for Outlook
entry.description: When enabled, an Adobe Send and Track button appears in Outlook when composing an email. It enables sending large files as public links through Outlook. The attached files are uploaded to Adobe Document Cloud and public links to the files are inserted in the email body. Recipients can click the link to preview the file in a browser window and can download the file if needed. Possible values include: 0: Enable Adobe Send and Track. 1: Disable Adobe Send and Track.

entry.name: Disable both updates to the product's web-plugin components as well as all services
entry.description: For product versions after 11.x, this new preference replaces the now deprecated HKCU services master switch bEnableAcrobatHS . It disables both updates to the product's web-plugin components as well as all services without exception, including any sign-in screen. The setting is not the same as bUpdater which resides directly under FeatureLockDown and disables product updates. Possible values include: 0: Disable services and service component updates. 1: Enable services.

entry.name: Disable cloud storage connectors
entry.description: Only supported on the Continuous track. Allows controlling in-product access to third party services for file storage. Dropbox support began with the Oct. 13, 2015 release. May 9, 2016: The preference now controls all the third-party connectors, including Box, OneDrive, and Dropbox (not SharePoint). When disabled, Possible values include: Possible values include: 0: Enable 3rd party connectors. 1: Disable 3rd party connectors. This preference disables 3rd party web connectors and their entry points from the product's UI, including in the Home view's left hand pane and under Add Account as well as custom Open/Save dialogs. If Document Cloud is also disabled, Open and Save dialogs revert to platform dialogs.

entry.name: Disable collecion of usage data for some of Acrobat's dialogs
entry.description: Disable collecion of usage data for some of Acrobat's dialogs. Possible values include: 0: Disable data collection ADM dialogs. 1 or null: Enable data collection.

entry.name: Disable Document Cloud service access
entry.description: This setting does not affect Adobe Send for Signature (Adobe Sign), preference synchronization, or third party connectors. For the base release, it also did not disable Send and Track (Share); however, it does control Send and Track with the July, 2015 release. For Acrobat Reader, this preference removes Create PDF, Export PDF, Organize, and Combine even if the ID has a subscription to those services. To disable all services, use bUpdater . Possible values include: 0: Enable Document Cloud services. 1: Disable Document Cloud services.

entry.name: Disable Document Cloud service access except those features controlled by the other preferences
entry.description: This setting does not affect Adobe Send for Signature (Adobe Sign), preference synchronization, or third party connectors. For the base release, it also did not disable Send and Track (Share); however, it does control Send and Track with the July, 2015 release. For Acrobat Reader, this preference removes Create PDF, Export PDF, Organize, and Combine even if the ID has a subscription to those services. To disable all services, use bUpdater . Possible values include: 0: Enable Document Cloud services. 1: Disable Document Cloud services.

entry.name: Disable Document Cloud storage
entry.description: DC storage is enabled by default. Possible values include: 0: Enable Document Cloud storage. 1: Disable Document Cloud storage.

entry.name: Disable JavaScript execution in PDFs
entry.description: Toggles JavaScript execution off globally; when off, the PDF cannot execute JavaScript.

entry.name: Disable Protected Mode which sandboxes Acrobat and Reader processes
entry.description: Protected Mode should be enabled to protect user systems and data. Possible values include: 0: Don't enable protected mode. 1: Do enable protected mode.

entry.name: Disable Repairs 1/2
entry.description: When working with virtualized installations, users should not be able to run repair from the help menu. Only an administrator should be able to invoke actions that may require a reboot of a Citrix server, WT server, and so on. To disable the menu item, create this preference and set the value to 1.

entry.name: Disable Repairs 2/2
entry.description: Specifies whether to disable the Help > Repair Installation menu for all users on virtual and and regular installs.

entry.name: Disable the Scan tab in Home view
entry.description: When enabled, links to scans appear under the Scan tab in the Home view. Possible values include: 0: Hide the scan tab. 1: Show the Scan tab.

entry.name: Disable the SharePoint and Office 365 integration features
entry.description: Controls the application's ability to detect that a file came from a Sharepoint server, disables the check-out prompt, and removes the SharePoint specific menu items. Possible values include: 0: Same as "null." Don't disable SharePoint and Office 365 integration. 1: Disable SharePoint and Office 365 integration.

entry.name: Disable the Updater and removes associated user interface items
entry.description: Manually this preference to disable updates. For 11.x products and earlier, this preference overrides any bDeclined value. For DC products, this setting overrides Mode. 0: Disables and locks the Updater. 1: No effect.

entry.name: Disable to automatically save documents (default user)
entry.description: Specifies whether or not to automatically save documents. Possible values include: 0: Don't auto save documents 1: Auto save documents.

entry.name: Disables upgrade product messages
entry.description: Products that don't provide the full set of features by default provide the user the opportunity to upgrade. For example, Reader users can purchase additional tools and features, and Acrobat Standard users can upgrade to Acrobat Professional. Possible values include: 0 or null: Don't disable upsell. 1: Disable upsell.

entry.name: Hide "make Adobe Acrobat the default PDF application" popup (default user)
entry.description: When Acrobat is not set as the default PDF handler and it is launched, a dialog prompts whether to make Adobe Acrobat the default PDF application. Possible values of this registry key are: 1: Do not show this message again 0: Show this message every time Acrobat is launched until it is set as the default PDF handler. You can create the key manually or use it using deployment to suppress the message.

entry.name: Hide messages from Adobe when a document opens
entry.description: This preference also controls messages in the right-hand pane for DC products as well as the "Learn More" link, including the "Start Free Trial" message promoting Acrobat. Possible values include: 0: Don't show messages from Adobe when a document opens. 1: Show messages from Adobe when a document opens.

entry.name: Hide messages from Adobe when the product launches
entry.description: This preference also hides the Share Feedback icon, removes messages such as the 11.x "end-of-life" warning, and disables the dialog prompt that urges users to complete their profile. In later product versions, this preference removes the Home banner (top message area) from the Home view. Possible values include: 0: Don't show messages from Adobe when the product launches. 1: Show messages from Adobe when the product launches.

entry.name: Hide the Save Signature UI
entry.description: When a user creates a new signature, the dialog offers the option to store the signature in the cloud for later use. This preference also controls saving user initials. Possible values include: 0: Show the Save Signature UI 1: Hide the Save Signature UI

entry.name: Locks the features associated with bShowMsgAtLaunch and bDontShowMsgWhenViewingDoc
entry.description: Locks the features associated with bShowMsgAtLaunch and bDontShowMsgWhenViewingDoc so that ends users can't change the settings. Possible values include: 0: Locks the feature so end users can't change the settings. 1: Allows users to change the settings. A value of 1 has the same affect as this key not existing at all.

entry.name: User - Hide "make Adobe Acrobat the default PDF application" (Windows 10) popup (default user)
entry.description: When Acrobat is not set as the default PDF handler and it is launched, a dialog prompts whether to make Adobe Acrobat the default PDF application. Possible values of this registry key are: 1: Do not show this message again 0: Show this message every time Acrobat is launched until it is set as the default PDF handler. You can create the key manually or use it using deployment to suppress the message.

entry.description: Keeps the Dropbox software updated.

entry.name: Dropbox Update Service (dbupdatem)
entry.description: Keeps the Dropbox software updated.

entry.description: Remove the ActiveSetup value

entry.name: Google Chome - ActiveSetup (WOW6432)
entry.description: Remove the ActiveSetup value

entry.name: Google Chome Elevation Service (GoogleChromeElevationService)
entry.description: Currently the elevation service is only installed for Google Chrome builds. The Primary use case at the moment for the service has to do with the Chrome recovery component. The recovery component is registered only for Google Chrome builds. It repairs Chrome Updater (Google Update) when the algorithm detects that Chrome is not being updated. Since Chrome could be installed per-system or per-user, an elevation service is needed to repair code in the per-system install case.

entry.name: Google Chrome Update - Update policy override Registry
entry.description: Specifies how Google Update handles available Google Chrome updates from Google. (0) Updates disabled (1) Always allow updates (2) Manual updates only (3) Automatic silent updates only

entry.name: Google Update - Auto-update check period override Registry
entry.description: Minimum number of minutes between automatic update checks. Set the value to 0 if you want to disable all auto-update checks

entry.name: Google Update - Disable AutoUpdate Checks Registry
entry.description: Disable AutoUpdate Checks (1) Disable automatic updates (0) Enable automatic updates

entry.name: Google Update - Update policy override default Registry
entry.description: Specifies the default policy for software updates from Google. (0) Updates disabled (1) Always allow updates (2) Manual updates only (3) Automatic silent updates only

entry.name: Google Update Service (gupdate)
entry.description: Google Update Service

entry.description: Google Update Service

entry.description: Rename the updater executable for Google Chrome

entry.description: Rename the updater executable for Google Chrome

entry.name: MS Edge - ActiveSetup
entry.description: Remove the ActiveSetup value

entry.name: MS Edge - ActiveSetup (WOW6432)
entry.description: Remove the ActiveSetup value

entry.name: MS Edge - Allow installation default Registry
entry.description: You can specify the default behavior of all channels to allow or block Microsoft Edge updates when Microsoft Edge Update is used. (0) Installs disabled (1) Always allow installs (4) Always allow Machine-Wide

entry.name: MS Edge - Microsoft Edge Update Service (edgeupdate)
entry.description: Keeps your Microsoft software up to date. If this service is disabled or stopped, your Microsoft software will not be kept up to date, meaning security vulnerabilities that may arise cannot be fixed and features may not work. This service uninstalls itself when there is no Microsoft software using it.

entry.name: MS Edge - Microsoft Edge Update Service (edgeupdatem)
entry.description: Keeps your Microsoft software up to date. If this service is disabled or stopped, your Microsoft software will not be kept up to date, meaning security vulnerabilities that may arise cannot be fixed and features may not work. This service uninstalls itself when there is no Microsoft software using it.

entry.name: MS Edge - MicrosoftEdgeUpdateTaskMachineCore Task
entry.description: Keeps your Microsoft software up to date. If this task is disabled or stopped, your Microsoft software will not be kept up to date, meaning security vulnerabilities that may arise cannot be fixed and features may not work. This task uninstalls itself when there is no Microsoft software using it.

entry.name: MS Edge - MicrosoftEdgeUpdateTaskMachineUA Task
entry.description: Keeps your Microsoft software up to date. If this task is disabled or stopped, your Microsoft software will not be kept up to date, meaning security vulnerabilities that may arise cannot be fixed and features may not work. This task uninstalls itself when there is no Microsoft software using it.

entry.name: MS Edge - Update policy override default Registry
entry.description: Lets you specify the default behavior for all channels concerning the way Microsoft Edge Update handles available updates for Microsoft Edge. (0) Updates disabled (1) Always allow updates (2) Manual updates only (3) Automatic silent updates only

entry.name: MS O365 - Office Automatic Updates 2.0 Task
entry.description: This task ensures that your Microsoft Office installation can check for updates.

entry.name: MS O365 - Office ClickToRun Service Monitor Task
entry.description: This task monitors the state of your Microsoft Office ClickToRunSvc and sends crash and error logs to Microsoft.

entry.name: MS O365 - Office Feature Updates Logon Task
entry.description: This task ensures that your Microsoft Office installation can check for feature updates.

entry.name: MS O365 - Office Feature Updates Task
entry.description: This task ensures that your Microsoft Office installation can check for feature updates.

entry.name: MS O365 - Office Subscription Maintenance Task
entry.description: Task used to ensure that the Microsoft Office Subscription licensing is current.

entry.name: MS O365 - OfficeBackgroundTaskHandlerLogon Task
entry.description: This task initiates Office Background Task Handler, which updates relevant Office data.

entry.name: MS O365 - OfficeBackgroundTaskHandlerRegistration Task
entry.description: This task initiates Office Background Task Handler, which updates relevant Office data.

entry.name: MS O365 - OfficeTelemetryAgentFallBack2016 Task
entry.description: This task initiates the background task for Office Telemetry Agent, which scans and uploads usage and error information for Office solutions.

entry.name: MS O365 - OfficeTelemetryAgentLogOn2016 Task
entry.description: This task initiates Office Telemetry Agent, which scans and uploads usage and error information for Office solutions when a user logs on to the computer.
